reviews.title: Really sweet
reviews.text: This is a little log cabin on the shore of Pippin Lake, a convenient place to stop if you're driving south from Fairbanks to Valdez. There's a full kitchen, a comfortable bed, and a spacious living/dining area. The owner stocks the kitchen with the makings for breakfast (milk, cereal, bagels, yoghurt, etc.). You have the use of both a canoe and a paddle boat if you want to go out on the lake to fish or just hang out. There's a gas barbeque if you get lucky when you're fishing. They even provide a plate of homemade cookies when you arrive! The only negative is the proximity of highway 4. The cabin is about 40-50 yards from a busy (though only 2 lanes) state highway. At night there's not much traffic but if you find traffic noise intrusive you might be bothered during the day.
